intro: Chorizanthe polygonoides var. polygonoides, commonly known as desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, showy flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in spikes along the stem. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry conditions. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in sandy soils and its role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
